page.title: 18Farming in Dalkeith
page.content: My farm, Wester Cowden, is typical of many in the area. We use machinery, have some animals, but mostly grow crops. The land is rented from the Duke of Buccleuch. My father, the Grieve, rents the land from the farmer, in turn. Our animals are mostly bullocks, which are taken to the market for sale. We have a beef herd, not a dairy herd. We grow wheat, barley, oats, corn, potatoes and turnips. The biggest field is 60 acres. Altogether our farm is 600 acres. We pay people to pick the potatoes for us. We have six Ford tractors. My father drives the Combine, Seeder, Plough, Dungspreader and Forklift. Dalkeith has established itself as a leading market town, with a cattle market on Mondays and an agricultural show every year in July.
